alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 4:55PM EDT until July 29 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern New Castle County in northern Delaware... North central Cumberland County in southern New Jersey... Central Salem County in southern New Jersey... Northwestern Gloucester County in southern New Jersey... South central Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Southern Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 455 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pike Creek, or over Newark, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Chester, West Deptford, Pennsville, Carneys Point, Elsmere, Paulsboro, Kennett Square, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Woodstown, Alloway, National Park, Swedesboro, Delaware City, Newport, Arden and Stanton. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 22. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
